intro: Pityphyllum hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Pityphyllum hirtzii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
